intro: Keetia molundensis var. macrostipulata, commonly known as the large-stipule keetia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its distinctive leaves with prominent stipules, which are leaf-like structures at the base of the leaf stalk. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often producing small, white or yellowish blooms. This variant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and limited distribution.
